thread.title: Second-year Flint Hill field hockey team is vastly improved
thread.title_full: Second-year Flint Hill field hockey team is vastly improved

author: A Staff Report
title: Second-year Flint Hill field hockey team is vastly improved
text:
Flint Hill field hockey team 
The Flint Hill School girls varsity field hockey team has won seven games. (Photo from Flint Hill) Posted: Saturday, October 24, 2015 7:20 am | Updated: 7:41 am, Sat Oct 24, 2015. Second-year Flint Hill field hockey team is vastly improved A Staff Report Northern Virginia Media Services | 0 comments 
In only its second year, the girls varsity field hockey team at the Flint Hill School has made a big improvement. 
The Huskies won only one game in their inaugural high school season, but returned many players this year. So far this fall, the team has a 7-9 record and has won four games in a row, including a 4-2 victory Oct. 23 against Middleburg Academy. 
In Independent School League play, Flint Hill has defeated Madeira, 2-0, and Holton-Arms, 2-1. 
In its first year, Flint Hill began building a program mostly from lacrosse players who were looking to play a fall sport. Most had never played field hockey. 
The school has started a junior varsity and middle-school program this fall. 
“This is a huge step for the future of the program because it means that girls will be learning the sport and developing their fundamental skills early on, so when they make it to the high school level we can focus on the higher level skills and competition,” Flint Hill coach Stefanie Vestal said. 
Two of Flint Hill’s top varsity players this fall are senior captains Hayden Garrett and Kate Zecca, who led the offense with multiple goals and assists. 
Juniors Caroline Shevlin, Anna Krisko and Tori Herman contribute regularly offensively. Juniors Carolyn Holoran, Sara Paulsen and Isabel Rice-Martorell and sophomores Bella Stork and Nina Jenkins anchor the defense. 
Sophomore goalie Nia Simmons has four shutouts and better than a 75 percent save ratio. 
“Together our defense has done a great job of moving the ball up the field,” Vestal said. Print Posted in Fairfax , Field hockey , Flint hill on Saturday, October 24, 2015 7:20 am. Updated: 7:41 am.
